definitions: To allow the existence, presence, practice, or act of (something unwanted or unpleasing) without interference or complaint.
To endure or resist the action of (a drug, poison, or environmental condition) without serious harm.
To accept or endure (someone or something) without protest or opposition.
To be able to take (a drug or food) without adverse side effects.
examples: The company is tolerating minor infractions.
Her body is tolerating the new medication well.
They are tolerating the noise from the construction.
He is tolerating spicy food better now.
